question: भारतीय संविधान के किस अनुच्छेद में मौलिक अधिकार दिए गए हैं?
explanation: भाग III (अनुच्छेद 12-35) में 6 मौलिक अधिकार दिए गए हैं: समानता, स्वतंत्रता, शोषण के विरुद्ध, धार्मिक स्वतंत्रता, सांस्कृतिक व शैक्षिक, संवैधानिक उपचार।

question: Who is known as the 'Father of the Indian Constitution'?
explanation: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar is known as the Father of the Indian Constitution. He was the Chairman of the Drafting Committee of the Constituent Assembly.

question: संसद के दो सदन कौन से हैं?
explanation: भारतीय संसद दो सदनों से मिलकर बनी है: लोकसभा (निचला सदन, 545 सदस्य) और राज्यसभा (ऊपरी सदन, 250 सदस्य)।

question: The Preamble to the Indian Constitution declares India as:
options: A Sovereign Socialist Secular Democratic Republic
explanation: After the 42nd Amendment (1976), the Preamble reads: 'Sovereign Socialist Secular Democratic Republic'. 'Socialist' and 'Secular' were added.

question: भारत के राष्ट्रपति का चुनाव कौन करता है?
explanation: राष्ट्रपति का चुनाव निर्वाचक मंडल द्वारा होता है जिसमें संसद के दोनों सदनों और राज्य विधानसभाओं के निर्वाचित सदस्य शामिल होते हैं।

question: Which Article of the Constitution deals with 'Right to Education'?
explanation: Article 21A (added by 86th Amendment, 2002) provides free and compulsory education to all children between 6-14 years as a fundamental right.

question: भारत में पंचायती राज प्रणाली किस संविधान संशोधन से आई?
explanation: 73वाँ संविधान संशोधन (1992) ने पंचायती राज संस्थाओं को संवैधानिक दर्जा दिया। 74वाँ संशोधन नगरपालिकाओं के लिए था।

question: The concept of 'Directive Principles of State Policy' is borrowed from:
explanation: DPSPs (Part IV, Articles 36-51) are borrowed from the Irish Constitution. They are guidelines for the state but not enforceable in court.

question: लोकसभा के सदस्यों का कार्यकाल कितने वर्ष का होता है?
explanation: लोकसभा का सामान्य कार्यकाल 5 वर्ष का होता है, किंतु इसे समय से पहले भंग किया जा सकता है।

question: Which is the highest court of India?
explanation: The Supreme Court of India (established under Article 124) is the apex judicial authority. It has original, appellate, and advisory jurisdictions.

question: Article 370 of the Indian Constitution was related to:
explanation: Article 370 granted special autonomous status to Jammu & Kashmir. It was effectively abrogated on August 5, 2019.

question: मौलिक कर्तव्यों को किस संविधान संशोधन में जोड़ा गया?
explanation: 42वाँ संविधान संशोधन (1976) द्वारा भाग IV-A (अनुच्छेद 51A) में 10 मौलिक कर्तव्य जोड़े गए। 86वें संशोधन में 11वाँ जोड़ा गया।

question: The first General Elections in India were held in:
explanation: India's first general elections were held from October 1951 to February 1952. The Indian National Congress won and Nehru became the first elected PM.

question: भारतीय संविधान कब लागू हुआ?
explanation: भारतीय संविधान 26 जनवरी 1950 को लागू हुआ, इसी दिन गणतंत्र दिवस मनाया जाता है। 26 नवंबर 1949 को इसे अपनाया गया था।

question: The total number of Schedules in the Indian Constitution is:
explanation: The Indian Constitution originally had 8 Schedules, currently has 12 Schedules dealing with various constitutional provisions.

question: The Constitution of India was adopted on:
explanation: The Constitution was adopted on 26 November 1949 and came into effect on 26 January 1950 (Republic Day).

question: Who is known as the 'Father of the Indian Constitution'?
explanation: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar was Chairman of the Drafting Committee and is regarded as the chief architect of the Indian Constitution.

question: The Preamble of the Constitution begins with:
explanation: The Preamble begins with 'We, the people of India' signifying popular sovereignty.

question: Fundamental Rights are enshrined in which Part of the Constitution?
explanation: Part III (Articles 12-35) of the Constitution deals with Fundamental Rights guaranteed to citizens.

question: How many Fundamental Duties are listed in the Constitution?
explanation: There are 11 Fundamental Duties listed in Article 51A (Part IV-A), added by 42nd Amendment (1976), 11th by 86th Amendment (2002).

question: The President of India is elected by:
explanation: The President is elected indirectly by an Electoral College consisting of elected members of Parliament and State Legislative Assemblies.

question: Rajya Sabha members are elected for a term of:
explanation: Rajya Sabha members serve 6-year terms, with one-third retiring every 2 years. Maximum strength is 250 members.

question: Right to Education was added as a Fundamental Right by which amendment?
explanation: 86th Amendment (2002) added Article 21A making free and compulsory education for 6-14 age group a Fundamental Right.

question: The Chief Justice of India is appointed by:
explanation: The Chief Justice of India is appointed by the President of India, conventionally the senior-most judge of the Supreme Court.

question: Directive Principles of State Policy are in which Part?
explanation: Part IV (Articles 36-51) contains DPSP which are guidelines for governance but not justiciable in courts.

question: The Panchayati Raj system was constitutionalized by:
explanation: 73rd Amendment (1992) constitutionalized Panchayati Raj, adding Part IX to the Constitution for rural local governance.

question: Emergency provisions are mentioned under which Articles?
explanation: Articles 352-360 deal with Emergency provisions: National (352), State (356), and Financial (360) emergencies.

question: Who is the constitutional head of the state in India?
explanation: The Governor is the constitutional (nominal) head of the state, appointed by the President for a 5-year term.

question: Right to vote in India is a:
explanation: Right to vote is a legal/statutory right (under Representation of People's Act 1951), not a Fundamental Right.

question: The concept of 'Secular State' means:
options: State has no official religion and treats all equally
explanation: Secularism (added by 42nd Amendment) means state treats all religions equally and has no state religion.

question: Money Bill can only be introduced in:
explanation: Money Bill can only be introduced in Lok Sabha (Article 109). Rajya Sabha can only suggest amendments within 14 days.

question: National Human Rights Commission was established in:
explanation: NHRC was established in 1993 under the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993 to protect civil liberties.

question: The maximum strength of Lok Sabha is:
explanation: Maximum strength of Lok Sabha is 552 (530 from states + 20 from UTs + 2 Anglo-Indians nominated - now discontinued).

question: Which Schedule of the Constitution deals with languages?
explanation: Eighth Schedule lists officially recognized languages (currently 22 languages after additions).

question: RTI (Right to Information) Act came into force in:
explanation: RTI Act 2005 came into force on 12 October 2005, empowering citizens to seek information from public authorities.

question: Who appoints the Election Commission of India?
explanation: The Chief Election Commissioner and Election Commissioners are appointed by the President of India.

question: The minimum age to become a member of Lok Sabha is:
explanation: Minimum age for Lok Sabha is 25 years and for Rajya Sabha is 30 years (Article 84).

question: GST was introduced in India from:
explanation: GST (Goods and Services Tax) was launched on 1 July 2017 through 101st Constitutional Amendment Act, 2016.

question: Inter-State Council is mentioned in Article:
explanation: Article 263 provides for establishment of Inter-State Council by the President to promote coordination between states.

question: NITI Aayog replaced which body?
explanation: NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India) replaced Planning Commission in 2015 as the policy think tank.
